intro: Macaranga boutonioides, commonly known as the African elephant tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its rapid growth rate and ability to colonize disturbed areas make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
